messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
My emergency, um, it's at 3209 Mink Road, Coitner's a P.A.
What town or province is that in?
Bucks County.
Okay, which police department serves that area?
It's the Springfield police station.
Oh, okay. And what is your cell number?
It's 267-980-8355. I requested the state police to come out.
Okay, what is your name?
My name is Doreen Berkland.
I already contacted the FBI as well.
Okay. What do you need the state police for, ma'am?
I shot my husband.
Okay. Where is he right now?
He's upstairs in the bedroom.
I tried to reach someone I've been in contact with in Bethlehem.
Okay. Is your husband awake and able to speak?
No, he is not.
Okay. Darlene, what's your last name?
Berklin, B-U-R-K-L-A-N-D.
Like I said, I called the FBI to find Tiffany Hill.
Why did you call the FBI?
They have been updated. I went to them several times about my ex threatening my life.
I just moved back into our residence because we are getting a divorce and the property wasn't selling because of him.
We had an argument, and I wasn't going to let him come at me again.
Okay. I'm having the Pennsylvania State Police dispatched right now.
Could you please ask for Mike Wolf? He knows about the things my husband was doing.
Okay. Where is the gun you used?
It's in the kitchen. Where do you want me to put it?
Leave it where it is.
What kind of gun was it?
It's a handgun. A .38.
My son's here too. He was outside working on his go-kart when the argument started. He's still outside.
He's 18. His name is Gabriel.
Where are you going to be in the residence?
Where do you want me to be?
Can you wait outside?
Sure, do you want me to be outside?
Yes, please stand outside with your son.
Okay. Do you want me to stay on the phone with you?
Yes, stay on the phone with me.
Gabe, the police are on the way.
I called the FBI to talk to Tiffany, but they can't locate her. She might have been transferred.
Do you remember the name of the FBI agent who interviewed you?
Anthony, he had an Italian last name. I have the notes somewhere.
And what was the Pennsylvania State Police trooper's name again?
Michael Wolf. He's out of Dublin.
Hold on one second.
Okay.
My son has nowhere to go. This is his home.
Is there a possibility he can stay here after they take me or come back to the house?
What's your son's name?
Gabriel.
The decision will be up to the Pennsylvania State Police when they arrive.
Gabriel, can you go to your grandmother's if you need to tonight?
I just asked him if he could stay here. It's going to be up to the state police.
Somebody in a blue van is backing up and coming in. Gabe, who is that?
Hold on one second. What kind of van is it?
It doesn't look like an ambulance. It's a van.
Okay, Darlene, I'm going to transfer you to the state police. Do not hang up.
Well, this is a guy in a van, not an ambulance.
I'm transferring you to the state police now. Hold on one second. Do not hang up.
Should I let him in the house? What should I do?
Just wait right there. Do not hang up.
He says he lives down the road.
Tell him to wait. Hold on one second.
You live down the road?
You weren't supposed to come here. The state police were supposed to arrive first.
Hold on one second. Do not hang up.
State Police Dublin, Corporal Glide.
Hi, it's Bucks County 911. We have someone named Darlene for you. Darlene, are you there?
Hello, Darlene, the state police are on the line now.
This is Corporal Glad from the state police.
